messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Missing posts??
messages.msgSnippet: **Oh - I did have an earthlink problem, Betsy, that caused bounces. They stopped deleting my mail off the server and I ran out of space, mail bounced and
messages.messageBody:
**Oh - I did have an earthlink problem, Betsy, that caused bounces. They
stopped deleting my mail off the server and I ran out of space, mail
bounced and yahoogroups stopped sending it. Don't know why the settings
had been changed.**

Yeah, I think that's what happened to me.

My purely guesswork theory is that it might have something to do with
the ads on yahoo groups now being animated. I hadn't noticed that
before, so it seems new.

I'm not too punctual about updating software, so maybe earthlink's
bounce problems with yahoo groups, which have happened before, don't
affect every version of the software.

(Also, I have my preferences set to "not HTML".)

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Missing posts??
messages.msgSnippet: Oh - I did have an earthlink problem, Betsy, that caused bounces. They stopped deleting my mail off the server and I ran out of space, mail bounced and
messages.messageBody:
Oh - I did have an earthlink problem, Betsy, that caused bounces. They
stopped deleting my mail off the server and I ran out of space, mail
bounced and yahoogroups stopped sending it. Don't know why the settings
had been changed.

--pam


On Friday, March 28, 2003, at 03:23 PM, Betsy wrote:

> I think the problem is with yahoo groups,
> but perhaps only for certain email programs. (I have Earthlink.) I had
> to go to groups.yahoo.com and fiddle around in "my groups" to fix the
> bouncing problem.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Missing posts??
messages.msgSnippet: ... I have earthlink, too, and no problems, Betsy. You re the first person who isn t on AOL that I ve heard having problems, though. And the others having
messages.messageBody:
On Friday, March 28, 2003, at 03:23 PM, Betsy wrote:

> I think the problem is with yahoo groups,
> but perhaps only for certain email programs. (I have Earthlink.) I had
> to go to groups.yahoo.com and fiddle around in "my groups" to fix the
> bouncing problem.
>
I have earthlink, too, and no problems, Betsy.

You're the first person who isn't on AOL that I've heard having
problems, though. And the others having problems are getting some mail
- just missing some in between - not missing one whole block of it.
So - it COULD be coincidence, I suppose. Life is always so ready to
throw confounding evidence into the mix <G>.

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Missing posts??
messages.msgSnippet: Lots of AOL people are complaining on lots of lists that they are not getting all their mail. You can read on the yahoogroups website, if you have reasonably
messages.messageBody:
Lots of AOL people are complaining on lots of lists that they are not
getting all their mail.

You can read on the yahoogroups website, if you have reasonably fast
internet access, for group mail.

You can get a hotmail or yahoo account and read from those, if AOL's
problem extends to its own webmail.

--pam

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Missing posts??
messages.msgSnippet: **I have received only digest  #3196 today. The last digest from yesterday that I received was #3192. Has anyone else had this problem?** I stopped receiving
messages.messageBody:
**I have received only digest #3196 today. The last digest from
yesterday that
I received was #3192. Has anyone else had this problem?**

I stopped receiving all yahoo groups mail some time between Wednesday
evening and Thursday morning. I think the problem is with yahoo groups,
but perhaps only for certain email programs. (I have Earthlink.) I had
to go to groups.yahoo.com and fiddle around in "my groups" to fix the
bouncing problem.

Betsy
